snippet: Critics of Leung Chun-ying, the city’s chief executive, have accused him of misleading the public on a controversial real estate issue, but he has appeared to retain the support of Beijing.
abstract: Thousands of demonstrators in rival marches crowd Hong Kong's main shopping district to praise or condemn city's chief executive Leung Chun-ying, who has been accused of misleading public on controversial real estate issue and of being puppet installed by Beijing; many of his critics favor greater democracy for Hong Kong, where chief executive is chosen by 1,200-member panel packed with Beijing loyalists.
lead_paragraph: Critics of Leung Chun-ying, the city’s chief executive, have accused him of misleading the public on a controversial real estate issue, but he has appeared to retain the support of Beijing.

headline.seo: In Hong Kong, Rival Protests Are Divided Over Leader
headline.main: In Hong Kong, Rival Protests Are Divided Over Leader
headline.print_headline:
Political Rift
Underlined
By Protests
In Hong Kong
